result.execSummary:
All charges against Tom Allen Dibbles in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tom Allen Dibbles is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tom Allen Dibbles

records.addlTxt:
11:29 AM Defendant Tom Allen Dibbles in court.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Tom Allen Dibbles.  Attorney Peter Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates case moving towards resolution. Requests status. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Tom Allen Dibbles in court.  Attorney Ellen Denise Craker in court for Tom Allen Dibbles.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes defense asking for additional time for defendant to complete treatment. Attorney Craker requests 45-60 days for status. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with victim 1, No use or possession of alcohol, No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.

01:48 PM Defendant Tom Allen Dibbles in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Peter James Marvin Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State indicates there is a stipulation to change bond conditions to no violent or abusive contact with the victim and may have contact with the address listed.

records.addlTxt: no contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key, Court will allow a one time contact to remove any personal property with police escort, must update address within 24 hours upon release from Jail,  No use or possession of alcohol,   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.

01:32 PM Defendant Tom A. Dibbles in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Tom A. Dibbles in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tom A. Dibbles appeared by video means with Attorney. Court requests middle name. Defendant's middle name is Allen. Atty Craker asks for alternate address from Defendant. Defendant does not have another address and there is no other family in the area.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. Court accepts plea of not guilty and will amend complaint for allen.   States request on bail: $1000 signature bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or their address,   No use or possession of alcohol,   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.
Atty Craker is requesting no violent or abusive contact with victim 1 and no objections to the State's other requests. 
State does indicate that the victim is present and has requested no contact. Court asks if anyone would like to address the Court. Victim remains quiet. 
Court orders $1000 signature bond with conditions of no contact with victim 1 or their address as listed in the ID Key, Court will allow one time contact to remove any personal property with police escort, Defendant must update address within 24 hours upon release from Jail,  No use or possession of alcohol,   No use or possession of a dangerous weapon.
  Status conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
